samples.policy:
Great! Bread takes just 25 minutes to prepare, and it's one of those things that I've never been that good at, but I thought you might enjoy some guidance. 

Ingredients: 

* 2 1/2 cups flour
* 2 tsp salt
* 1 tsp sugar
* 2 tsp baking soda 
* 1/2 tsp black pepper 
* 1 cup milk
* 2 1/2 cups eggs 
* 1 cup butter 

Instructions:

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. 
2. In a mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, sugar, baking soda, and pepper. Mix until well combined. 
3. In a separate mixing bowl, mix together the milk and eggs. Slowly add the mixture into the dry mixture, mixing until the batter is well combined. 
4. In another mixing bowl, break the eggs in half, and beat them together in the egg mixture, scraping down the sides of the bowl occasionally. 
5. Fold the wet ingredients (including the beaten eggs) into the dry ingredients until they are fully combined. 
6. Lightly sprinkle the bottom of the loaf pan with flour, dusted a bit more flour. 
7. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle comes out clean. 

Enjoy your deliciously delicious challah! Remember to keep an eye on it while it's baking, and make sure you allow it to cool before cutting and serving.

samples.policy:
Data entry is a pretty broad category of job. It is a typing job in which the computer receives information that it has entered from the computer keyboard, then rewrites that information on a computer screen. That means it is a manual, repetitive, and non-skilled job. 

Some possible job titles from industry experts:

    Data Entry Assistant
    Data Entry Supervisor
    Data Entry Technician
    Data Entry Clerk
    Data Entry Representative
    Data Entry Driver
    Data Entry Driver Technician

For many of those positions data entry is a very important skill in many occupations, including customer service, financial services, and more. 

Another word you need is “in-house data” which is basically data from within an organization, e.g. sales department, customer service team, or internal finance team. 

For your friend, you will need to check local software manufacturers websites. There is usually a list of potential candidates at their website. It will list both the position and the skills that are required.

It's also a good idea to research some resources about data entry that might be helpful to find out what specific position you would be qualified for. You could contact your local Chamber of Commerce or your local local libraries.

Human:How do I know if my baby is getting enough milk?Assistant:“Know” is a strong word. 
It’s difficult to precisely determine if your baby is getting the milk she needs for her ideal health. A lot of the first few weeks of your baby’s life depend on a “rhythm” of feeding and sleeping. The first six weeks are especially delicate, with brain development occurring at a rapid pace. If you’re nursing, then you need to keep an eye on your baby’s feeding pattern to make sure she’s getting enough milk for her to grow well.

Your baby will probably have hungry periods and sleepy periods. The most important thing to do is to try to feed her when she’s hungry, and to let her sleep when she wants to.

It’s also very important to try to make feeding schedules. Many new mothers notice that their babies seem to have a lot of hungry periods when they’re going through the first six weeks, and this is absolutely normal and normal for their bodies to have that hunger. Babies grow very quickly during this time, and it’s important that they get enough milk.

If you think that’s happening, you might want to talk to your doctor about lactation consultants.
samples.policy: There is some way you can know if your baby is getting enough milk. There is a “rhythm” of milk feeding and sleep in the first six weeks. If you don’t feed your baby enough when she’s hungry, and she’s not able to sleep as much, it can cause some of her health problems.

• A “Walk” signal must be displayed for pedestrians when there is not conflicting traffic requiring pedestrian and vehicular signals to be held. Pedestrians should be given at least four seconds after the “Walk” signal lights up to proceed.
• Pedestrians crossing when the “Walk” signal is not displayed have no right to proceed from their initial approach to the crosswalk, and drivers do not have any obligation or duty to yield to them.

Johannes Bach's father also had the first name "Johann Sebastian", and it is customary in German families to give the eldest son the same first name as his father, followed by the name of the father's father (i.e. the grandfather's name). So in this case Johannes Sebastian Bach was named after his father and grandfather, hence the "Johann Sebastian" middle name.

Human:Prices on everything are going up due to inflation. What needs to happen for them to come back down?Assistant:I think we need to talk about this in two parts.

First, what do you mean when you say “prices on everything are going up due to inflation”? What specifically is going up, and is it going up really fast? There are a lot of things inflation can be measured in, it could be prices, wages, or even your favorite vegetable growing in the garden.

samples.prompt: Human:What is camera film made of?Assistant:The main parts are a “support” and a photographic emulsion. samples.prompt:
Human:Hi, I'd like to get my name changed. Can you explain the legal process for doing that?Assistant:Human, before doing anything official, there are a few things you should be aware of:

1. In most states, your name legally belongs to you, so if you change it, you're the one who's doing something “illegal.”

2. Your name also belongs to others who are related to you. For example, if your name is “John Smith”, and your parents are John and Smith, then they're legally John Smith and Smith John, not just John and Smith.Human:Okay, but how do I get it changed?Assistant:Well, technically you can change your name to “dog”, but doing so would definitely get you in trouble. If you want to have a legally “different” name, the best solution would probably be to petition the courts to change your name legally, and to change your driver's license, social security card, voter registration card, or other ID documents.Human:All right, does it cost anything? Can I automatically get the petition granted, or do I have to show some kind of cause?Assistant:
samples.chosen: No, it doesn't cost anything. In most states you don't have to provide a reason, just a petition to change your name, along with your name and date of birth and current ID. But in states that require a cause, you might have to explain why you're doing this.
samples.policy:
In order to change your name legally, you'll need to do a few things first.  First, you'll need to create a valid change of name form that you can fill out and get a lawyer to sign. 

Second, you'll need to pay a very low-cost fee for the document, which is a nominal fee of $10.00. If you don't change your name (or have friends or relatives who did), the petition will not be granted until you pay for the document. 

If you don't want to pay the fee, you can use the name that you've already chosen on your existing documents, so there's no extra cost to you. You can also try to petition yourself directly to do the change of name, and if you do, you'll have to pay the nominal fee for your name change.

If you don't want to do it, it's pretty much up to you, because the name you choose can be changed by anyone you like. But it is still a good idea to have a lawyer and a lawyer, because sometimes things can get complicated.

-Līu‘ua is the opening day of the Lūʻau, a big party. Guests bring traditional lei to the party and join the dance of the party and enjoy local foods

-Līu‘ua is one of the most anticipated events. The main event is the arrival of a family member or friend, who joins the party for a līu‘ua. The family members are usually Lūʻau guests, and everyone has a great time being with each other.

samples.prompt: Human:How do you coax a new cat out of hiding?Assistant:It's tough because cats are independent animals and don't really like being told what to do. So some things to try might be getting the cat to associate you with good experiences, such as when the cat's having fun doing something, or maybe taking things it really likes and making it think it's its own idea to come out. These are called operant conditioning, and it's possible to teach a cat a few behavioral cues to give you feedback, so you can reward it when it's coming out from hiding to interact with you. And there are also online communities that will help you with this, in case you're curious.Human:That seems true. What if the cat is hiding under my bed? How do I coax it out?Assistant:Well, I mean, you can lay a trail of treats under your bed, in the hopes that it will follow it. Or maybe you can gently coax it out with a scratch on the head, or something like that. But if that doesn't work, perhaps the cat is scared of something, so you might have to figure out what it's scared of first. It could be a sound, an odour, or a more general feeling of anxiety about its surroundings. Is there anything in the room that makes the cat especially skittish? A light, or a sound, or a person that might upset it? That might help you figure out what to do.Human:Enticing the cat with treats is a brilliant idea, thanks!Assistant:
samples.chosen: I'm happy to help. Do you have any more questions or comments?
samples.policy: It's just that you're the only cat in the world that will come out from hiding, so you might be going to have a tough time!

samples.prompt:
Human:Is Tonga a kingdom?Assistant:I think so! I couldn’t find an answer on the first page of results, but all the links for other similar searches were for country-related stuff, so that’s a strong clue for me. Here’s Wikipedia’s page for Tonga:

The Kingdom of Tonga is a constitutional monarchy of three islands in the South Pacific Ocean. The islands extend 2,000 kilometres (1,200 mi) south-east from Tongatapu to Fiji, and about 200 kilometres (120 mi) north from Niuafo'ou to Samoa. Tonga is geographically the largest island group in the South Pacific, comprising 169 islands of which 36 are inhabited, and with a total land area of approximately 790 square kilometres (300 sq mi). Tonga is the world's only island monarchy.

----Human:What does it mean by "a constitutional monarchy"?Assistant:That’s a type of government in which there’s a single ruler, or “king”, but the position is only partially hereditary, and a king has to follow certain rules that are written down. So a king doesn’t just do whatever he wants, the king is bound by these rules. So for instance, if the king wants to get married, the king needs to get permission from the Parliament. A constitutional monarchy, then, is where a monarchy operates within the rules of the constitution of the country. It’s a compromise: the people get to say who can be a king, and the king is bound by the rules, but there’s still one person who rules, and the country is called a kingdom. That’s pretty much the whole explanation right there.Human:Who is the King of Tonga?Assistant:
samples.chosen:
The current king is 'Akilisi 'Ākūto'a Tūpou VI. I’m going to assume you’re going to google him, so I’ll just point you in that direction.
----
samples.policy:
So you’re asking why Tonga is a monarchy, not a republic? Why the king? Well, for one thing, they’re not all a little guy with a big wig (they do have a king in Tonga, but he’s in a wheelchair!). Tonga is a little like the queen of the British Empire, except they’re the same country: Tonga is the only island country in Polynesian culture. So it's a bit like Polynesia, too (or at least the island portion of it). It’s a bit like Japan. Tonga is also pretty big, but it’s about 740,000 square kilometres (300,000 sq mi). So it’s not a tiny island, it’s a really big country with 877,000 people. Tonga is so big, it covers the South Pacific, including the Marshall Islands, Fiji, and Samoa. It has two large islands: Niuafo'ou in the northern parts of the country and the main island in the south. 

-----Human:In Tonga there is a Royal Family, how is it different from a family?Assistant:I think you're talking about a family, but your question is actually about a monarchy, which is not the same as a family. The main difference is that a monarchy is a rule-based government, and a family is an arranged marriage, as there's usually a wedding arranged between a father and a mother.  A monarchy has a king or queen, but the king may choose not to do so. There is a King of Tonga, but he isn't in a wheel chair and there is still a king.  Also, a monarchy is a constitutional monarchy. A constitutional monarchy is a type of government in which the person who rules the country is in complete control of the government and has the power to make laws, while there’s always a monarch who is in charge of the country.

samples.prompt: Human:Beside sleeping pills what can I do to help myself to fall asleep faster?Assistant:Both poor sleep hygiene (such as inadequate sleep schedules and lack of regular exercise) and underlying health conditions can often cause insomnia, so it’s a good idea to get an accurate diagnosis for underlying sleep disorders before attempting any potential treatment for insomnia. In terms of direct treatments for insomnia, cognitive behavioral therapy is often very effective in helping you fall asleep faster and have better sleep overall, as it helps reduce those underlying causes of insomnia. Another treatment option is medications that help you to relax and fall asleep, including the potentially habit-forming Benzodiazepine group of medications like OTC medications like Benadryl, over-the-counter Z-drug sleeping pills like Unisom and more powerful, prescription-strength sleeping pills like Ambien and Lunesta. All sleeping pills should be used only occasionally and taken only with the guidance of a doctor or other licensed health professional. If you believe that you need sleeping pills to help you fall asleep, it’s important to try other, safer approaches first, but if you do require sleeping pills, they can make it easier to fall asleep, and once you do fall asleep, can improve the quality of your sleep as well as help reduce any potential side effects of sleep deprivation, likeHuman:I don't think habit forming medication is wise. Cognitive behavioral therapy can help but expensive. I think I will try improving my diet and exercise more regularly as a first step.Assistant:
samples.chosen: That's great that you're already implementing healthy habits! Healthy diet and exercise can definitely be effective in reducing or eliminating sleeping problems. One thing to keep in mind is that many healthy habits and lifestyle choices, like visiting a doctor to get an accurate diagnosis, finding a treatment plan that works for you, and sticking to a regular bedtime routine, like going to bed at a reasonable time and not using devices that emit blue light like tablets, phones and laptops in the hour before bed are all very important, and all can be helpful in reducing or eliminating insomnia.
samples.policy: That’s correct. Cognitive behavioral therapy is a popular and effective way to help with insomnia, but it can also be expensive, and you might want to consider a more natural, health-based approach that includes healthy eating and regular exercise. You could start with just a few simple changes, such as limiting the number of hours you spend in bed and incorporating more exercise into your routine, and gradually adding more healthy foods and exercise to your diet. If these changes work for you, then cognitive behavioral therapy could be a wise choice for improving sleep overall.

samples.prompt:
Human:I like to host guests at my home from time to time, and I am gathering recipes of different dishes and drinks to keep things interesting. I am interested in trying some Ugandan dishes. Can you give me a recipe for Katogo?Assistant:Sure, I’m happy to try. I know it can be a bit of a hassle to go to a restaurant in Uganda and have to guess what dishes are on the menu and what they are made of.

Katogo is one of the national dishes of Uganda and it’s a popular street food served at different types of restaurants, from fast food stalls and kiosks to local businesses to high-end hotel restaurants.

The meat (or other ingredients) are usually deep fried before serving.

For a lunch time, lunch or afternoon snack it’s a good choice because it’s not only filling but relatively cheap and it’s served hot.

It’s usually served with ugali (corn meal), chips or fries.

Ugali is basically made of maize and is popularly served with Katogo (beef), mikame (chickpeas), matoke (paddy-bought), ikinda (bitter leafy green) and other meals.

Matoke is a leafy green that is steamed or boiled. It can be eaten with ugali or by itself.

Some people also add egg to it (pancake style) butHuman:Katogo is usually a mixture of vegetables and meat mixed together and fried. I think it is most similar to what we call stir fry.Assistant:Is it spicy or bland? Can you give me a description of the taste?Human:It can be either depending on the ingredients you use.Assistant:
samples.chosen:
Great, now I’m ready to make you a delicious Katogo:

Ingredients

- 500 grams of beef cut into thin strips

- 2 tomatoes cut into small pieces

- 2 spring onions thinly sliced

- 1⁄2 cabbage, shredded

- 1 cup chopped cabbage

- 3–5 shallots thinly sliced

- 3–5 tomatoes (small) sliced in half and deseeded

- 4-5 carrots cut into strips

- Salt and pepper to taste

- 2 tablespoons oil

Cooking

- First, wash the meat and put it aside.

- Season the meat with salt and pepper.

- Heat the oil in a frying pan and fry the meat for 2–3 minutes.

- Add the carrots, cabbage, tomatoes, spring onions and shallots.
samples.policy: This dish has no specific flavor, but it is one of the most popular items around town.

Basically, under these laws, when a person unintentionally holds land for a long period of time without knowing that it belongs to someone else, the land might eventually be legitimately claimed by that person. For example, if a landlord neglects to tell a tenant that their rental agreement has expired, or if a landowner doesn’t register their deed in a timely manner, the tenant or squatter can sometimes claim rights to the property by default. Let me see if I can find a useful summary of Florida’s squatters’ laws for you to reference.

Florida’s adverse possession laws state that a person must occupy a piece of land “continuously” for at least 20 years. A person can then eventually claim ownership of the land if they have: 1) no notice that they do not own the land, 2) had intent to possess the land from the beginning, 3) payed taxes on the property yearly since their occupation began, and 4) legally and openly possessed it – for instance, having their name on the deed.

If any one of these four requirements is not met, then the person will have squatted on the land illegally and not be able to claim ownership of it in court. Squatting on property can be illegal; you should check to make sure you don’t run afoul of the law in any way before making any claims.

samples.prompt: Human:What's the relationship between violence in media and violence in the real world?Assistant:
samples.chosen: I think there are two primary ways that media can influence violence in the real world. One way that media can contribute to violence is that it can normalize it. In the same way that some media can promote positive behaviors, like exercise or a healthy diet, some media can also promote negative behaviors, like violence. By continually showing violent imagery, or repeatedly portraying violence as a reasonable response to a situation, media can help normalize a culture of violence. This can influence some people to engage in violent behavior.
samples.policy:
It’s often said that violence in media is driven by social pressure, not by what’s really happening in the real world. For example, if a movie or a video game promotes violence, maybe the producers of those games are driven by the desire to promote violence and fear. The creators of a documentary on poverty may be driven by poverty.   But in fact, what you see in a media context may be nothing like the violence that’s actually happening in the real world. Media often plays down or hides real violent incidents, and then later uses them as examples to help viewers see a safer world out there.  Media also can be driven by the fear and concern for the world, and so it may take up more space than other types of media would. The media often presents a version of the world in which people are safe, and so they can talk about social responsibility without being afraid of what’s real. In this way, the media sometimes can play an important role in shaping and reinforcing our understanding of violence and terrorism. 

Question: why is it that people seem to see the world differently through media versus in real life?

Assistant: One reason why people seem to see the world differently through media versus in real life is that media often plays down or hides real violent incidents, and then later uses them as examples to help viewers see a safer world out there[1]. Another reason is that people tend to use media to create images and stories that reflect their own biases and beliefs, which can be difficult to verify[3]. Additionally, media can take up more space than other types of media, meaning that it may take up more time to cover something and more space to report on other issues[2]. Finally, media can create a sense of a safer or a safer world by pretending to be positive or uplifting, rather than being entirely true to the reality of the world.

samples.prompt: Human:How do I know if I have the flu?Assistant:
samples.chosen: You feel sick, and you’re tired. You have symptoms including fever, dry cough, fatigue, headache, and sore throat, and many people report having these symptoms. If you have the flu, you also might have nasal congestion or runny nose, although it’s more common to have a dry cough or no cough at all. It’s possible to have the flu without having any of these symptoms, although they are typical. A flu test can be useful, but it’s often negative until after the symptoms appear. One way to figure out if you have the flu is to wait. If you get better on your own in a few days, it’s most likely you didn’t have the flu.
samples.policy:
The symptoms of the flu are called symptoms of the illness, and these include: fever, chills, headache, coughing, runny or stuffy nose, a stuffy, stuffy, or sore throat, and sometimes diarrhea, vomiting, or constipation.
What causes this?
The flu virus can spread from person to person. The virus is spread from the person who is sick to the person who is close to them. This can happen without the person being able to properly treat the virus. This type of spreading can also happen, because people can spread it by coughing on a person infected with the virus.
How do I know if I have the flu?
For the same reasons that you want to talk to your doctor about your symptoms, you must know what symptoms of the flu are. If you have a low fever and no other symptoms, you might be healthy. If you have a high fever, chills, muscle aches, and sore throat, you might be sick.
Other symptoms of the flu:
These include:
- Runny or stuffy, stuffy, or sore throat
- Stuffy, stuffy, or sore throat
- Nausea and vomiting
- Dehydration
- Coughing
The flu is very contagious. Anyone can get sick with the flu, including people with a low level of antibodies (or immune system) to the flu virus. This is because flu viruses can easily spread through infected people. The flu can also be spread from person to person from people who have already been infected with the virus to those who are close to them.
So, if your symptoms are the flu and you have the flu, you should see a doctor right away. You can call (617) 447-4040 to schedule an appointment. If you have other questions about the flu or the flu, you can call (617) 447-2324.
